intro: Lisianthius francisiae, commonly known as the Hawaiian lisianthium, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange ray flowers and dark purple disk flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of mesic forests, where it thrives in the unique microclimate of Hawaii. It has small, narrow leaves and produces small, herbaceous stems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
